page.title: 08HOUSING IN HARLOW
page.content: Harlow is full of new houses built since 1950.There are lots of different types of designs which make journeys through Harlow interesting.The Housing Officer told us that most dwellings are two storey.He also told us that 29% of houses had 1 bedroom,37% had 2 bedrooms,30% had 3 bedrooms and only 4% had 4 bedrooms.We did a survey of 3 schools and found that from a sample of 100 people 66% rented their house and 34% owned their house.In our twelve squares,just over half is taken up by housing which does leave quite alot of space for recreation.Still some estates do seem a bit crowded. There is a fair bit of vandalism which spoils the houses.Our survey told us that 60% of houses were terraced.Most of the houses are brick built although quite a few are concrete which aren't as friendly looking.
